Mr. Buck is the career and technical education teacher for IMPACTâ€”the Institute of Media Production Arts and Creative Technology. This past Saturday RCOE and Norco College hosted the first-ever Riverside County Esports League Championship Tournament. A total of eight high school teams, previously qualified in the north and south county semifinal competitions, battled for the title of 2020 Fall/Winter #RCOEesports Champs.

Full Event Photo Gallery: http://bit.ly/2020RCOEesports

In this double-elimination Super Smash Bros. Ultimate tournament, Chaparral High was able to reset the bracket in the final round and that round came down to one exciting match. With great sportsmanship, Murrieta Valley High School's team took the match and the 2020 Fall/Winter Tournament Esports Championship title. Temecula Valley USD's Chaparral High took second place and Corona Norco USD's Centennial High took third.

Congratulations to all of our esports competitors who advanced and competed in Saturday's championship tournament.

For more information on RCOE's Esports League visit: https://www.rcoe.us/esports

Online pre-registration is available for eligible 16- and 17-year-olds by visiting registertovote.ca.gov. California youth who pre-register to vote will have their registration become active once they turn 18 years old.

Pre-registration does not change the voting age, which is 18. Instead, it allows eligible Californians ages 16 or 17 to complete the online voter registration form providing sufficient time and opportunity to get ready to vote.

The new online pre-registration applies to California youth who are 16 or 17 and meet the following criteria: a United States citizen and a resident of California, not currently in state or federal prison or on parole for the conviction of a felony, and not currently found mentally incompetent to vote by a court.
